channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Five minutes with Nintendo’s new Virtual Boy told me everything I need to know about the Nintendo Switch Online-exclusive retro gaming peripheral
item.description: We've tried the new Nintendo Virtual Boy accessory for Switch 2 and Switch consoles — here are the three main things you need to know.

item.title: Alphabet won’t talk about the Google-Apple AI deal, even to investors
item.description: Alphabet CEO skipped an analyst's question about Apple on the company's earnings call.

item.title: The Best Super Bowl TV Deals (2026)
item.description: Upgrade your viewing setup before inviting your friends over to watch the big game.

item.title: Course à l’IA | Google fait exploser ses investissements déjà records
item.description: Alphabet, maison mère de Google, a encore affiché mercredi une santé robuste dopée par l’intelligence artificielle (IA), et a annoncé un quasi doublement en 2026 de ses investissements déjà massifs dans la course à l’armement technologique qui agite la Silicon Valley.

item.title: I Really Hope the New ‘Ghost in the Shell’ Anime Keeps the Major’s Manga Goofiness
item.description: Science Saru's new spin on the iconic sci-fi manga has a chance to bring back some whimsy in a major way.

item.title: 'We're still a home furnishing company, it's just that adding smart functionality can give our products superpowers': IKEA exec shares the brand's big smart home plans
item.description: Exclusive: 'In the long term we don't really see smart products as a segment at all.'

item.title: Google’s Gemini app has surpassed 750M monthly active users
item.description: Google revealed a significant milestone for its Gemini app, announcing over 750 million monthly active users as it competes with ChatGPT and Meta AI.

item.title: Google’s annual revenue tops $400 billion for the first time
item.description: Google's parent company, Alphabet, has earned more than $400 billion in annual revenue for the first time. The company announced the milestone as part of its Q4 2025 earnings report released on Wednesday, which highlights the 15 percent year-over-year increase as its cloud business and YouTube continue to grow. As noted in the earnings report, […]

item.title: The most expensive Pi yet - 'unprecedented rise' in RAM pushes Raspberry Pi prices to their highest level ever, pushing it out of reach of schools and kids
item.description: Raspberry Pi prices climb again as AI-driven memory shortages raise costs, reducing access for students, schools, and hobbyists.

item.title: Senators grill Waymo and Tesla over robotaxi safety, liability, and China
item.description: During a two-hour hearing in the US Senate Wednesday, top executives from Waymo and Tesla urged lawmakers to take action on long-stalled legislation to speed the deployment of self-driving cars on public roads. But after two hours of Q&A around a number of hot-button topics, including robotaxi safety, legal liability, remote operation, and China, it […]...

item.title: Valentines Day sex toy deals are already heating up. Save up to 85% on famous toys.
item.description: We rounded up the best Valentine's Day sex toy deals for 2026. Save big on goodies from top brands like Lovehoney and Good Vibes.

item.title: The Wayback Machine debuts a new plug-in designed to fix the internet’s broken links problem
item.description: Should a linked web page go offline, the new feature will then redirect readers to the archived versions, so that there is no drop in service. The tool also archives a user's own posts, helping to ensure their longevity.

item.title: Zohran Mamdani Responds to Polymarket’s Free Grocery Store Stunt
item.description: Polymarket and Kalshi try to appeal to New Yorkers as regulatory scrutiny intensifies.

item.title: You Won’t Believe What’s Stuck in This Deer’s Antlers—and It’s a 2026 People’s Choice Finalist
item.description: It's time for the People's Choice Wildlife Photography Award, in which the public can vote on nature's most stunning—and disturbing—shots of the year.

item.title: Somehow, I’d Never Heard of This Post-Apocalyptic Football Movie
item.description: 'The Blood of Heroes' was released in 1989 and stars Rutger Hauer, Delroy Lindo, and Vincent D'Onofrio.

item.title: How to turn off the dreaded ‘soap opera’ effect on your TV
item.description: Your TV may be causing the soap opera effect, where movies look 'unreal': these are the settings you need to adjust or turn off.

item.title: This RTX 5070-powered Asus ROG Strix G16 is the mid-range gaming laptop I'd recommend to avoid extreme RAM and storage prices
item.description: Go big without going broke

item.title: Elon Musk’s SpaceX company town is getting a police department
item.description: The new department will have up to eight police officers and could be up and running in a few months.

item.title: Meet Gizmo: A TikTok for interactive, vibe-coded mini apps
item.description: Gizmo's app is like a TikTok for vibe-coded mini apps... and it's a lot of fun.

item.title: AI SRE Resolve AI confirms $125M raise, unicorn valuation
item.description: The two-year-old startup confirms that it closed a Series A led by Lightspeed at $1 billion valuation.

item.title: Google parent Alphabet predicts a sharp surge in 2026 capital spending on AI
item.description: Revenue at Google Cloud grew 48% to $17.7 billion in the fourth quarter ended December, beating analyst’s expectations. Alphabet said on Wednesday it was targeting capital expenditure of $175 billion to $185 billion this year, in yet another aggressive ramp-up in spending from the Google parent as it deepens its investments to push ahead in the AI race....

item.title: Nintendo’s new Virtual Boy is more fun to look at than to play
item.description: Though the Virtual Boy was both a commercial and critical failure, the console's infamy is part of what has made it such a fascinating piece of Nintendo's history. Original units are still going for hundreds of dollars on bidding sites, and hobbyists have spent years keeping the Virtual Boy alive through emulation and homebrew games. […]
